thread.title: Ryan Gosling Reversed Your Favorite Layering Move
thread.title_full: Ryan Gosling Reversed Your Favorite Layering Move

title: Ryan Gosling Reversed Your Favorite Layering Move
text:
Ryan Gosling Reversed Your Favorite Layering Move By Facebook nich503 / Splash News 
There’s nothing wrong with relying on the classics in your wardrobe, but finding ways to not look like a carbon copy of every dude standing in line with you at Starbucks is also worthwhile. For evidence of that, see the reversed layering move Ryan Gosling pulled while out in Los Angeles yesterday. 
A white T-shirt, black jeans, and combat boots is standard modern-guy style, but where Gosling deviated from the norm is with his top layers. While most guys reach for a plaid shirt or flannel and add a leather jacket on top to complete the look, Gosling did the opposite. He treated his leather jacket like a cardigan and added a check shirt-jacket as the final layer. It’s a combo we’ve seen him wear before using different pieces, and we like it because it’s just distinctive enough to stand out (it’s all in the lapels), without begging for attention. After all, we know Gosling likes to keep a low profile when he's not doing the dashing three-piece-suit thing . 
Now, admittedly, you shouldn't try this move if you have a tendency to sweat. It’s probably best for guys who live in cold climates or have a high tolerance for insulation. The last thing a big, sweaty guy needs is two boxy, heavy jackets constricting his armpits and back. But if you’re built like Gosling (give or take a muscle or two) and keep things as supremely chill as he does, you can pull it off. It helps if you’ve broken the leather jacket in to the point where it feels like a second skin, and if neither jacket is lined too heavily. The last thing you need in the mix here is shearling. Watch Now: Ryan Gosling Goes Swimming in His Ralph Lauren Suit
